result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon M. Krohn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Sentence is concurrent to Wood County Probation.

superMiscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school.
No contact with C.R., her family, nor residence.

Counseling.
DNA sample and surcharge.
Defendant eligible for CIP and SAP.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held before Honorable Michael K. Moran on 1/8/2015
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called:  3:09pm. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Julie Sawyer. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (crim trespass dwelling) & ct 3 (dc) - crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (burglary building). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Victim Witness Coordinator K.W. reads victim impact statement. Atty Sawyer makes statement. Defendant makes statement. COURT ORDERS: WI State Prison Total of 4 yrs & 6 months; Initial Confinement 18 months; Extended Supervision 3 yrs; 1 day credit. Sentence is concurrent to Wood County Probation. EXTENDED SUPERVISON CONDITIONS: No contact with C.R.; family or residence; Counseling; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; DNA Sample & Surcharge; Court Costs. Defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. Crt advises and defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form. Crt remands Defendant to Marathon Cty Sheriff to be transported to Dodge Correctional as reception site. Adjourned: 3:25pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Plea hearing set
Status conference on December 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
